citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During the review of IACUC records, an adverse event was found involving the death of a rabbit that was associated with
the incorrect administration of an anesthetic medication. On April 10, 2025, a rabbit (#111) was undergoing a procedure
from an IACUC approved protocol (RAB693) when the animal began to rouse from anesthesia. A technician quickly
administered a full dose of ketamine to the animal through an intravenous catheter in attempts to return the animal to a
surgical plane of anesthesia. Following the administration of the medication, the animal stopped breathing. A veterinarian
was quickly notified and the veterinary team attempted to resuscitate the rabbit, but it died acutely. The approved protocol
allows for an additional dose of ketamine given subcutaneously if needed to maintain anesthesia throughout the
procedure. The intravenous administration of ketamine had not been approved.
It is important for the IACUC to review and approve any significant changes regarding the care and use of animals in
ongoing research activities to ensure the well-being and humane treatment of all research animals.
The IACUC shall review and approve, require modifications (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed
significant changes regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing activities.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
GLORIA MCFADDEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.31(c)(7)  Critical Repeat
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
During the review of IACUC records, an adverse event was found involving the death of a rabbit that was associated with 
the incorrect administration of an anesthetic medication. On April 10, 2025, a rabbit (#111) was undergoing a procedure 
from an IACUC approved protocol (RAB693) when the animal began to rouse from anesthesia. A technician quickly 
administered a full dose of ketamine to the animal through an intravenous catheter in attempts to return the animal to a 
surgical plane of anesthesia. Following the administration of the medication, the animal stopped breathing. A veterinarian 
was quickly notified and the veterinary team attempted to resuscitate the rabbit, but it died acutely. The approved protocol 
allows for an additional dose of ketamine given subcutaneously if needed to maintain anesthesia throughout the 
procedure. The intravenous administration of ketamine had not been approved.  
It is important for the IACUC to review and approve any significant changes regarding the care and use of animals in 
ongoing research activities to ensure the well-being and humane treatment of all research animals. 
The IACUC shall review and approve, require modifications (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed 
significant changes regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing activities. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
GLORIA MCFADDEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
